title: When we die, do we go to another dimension? - Quora

response.answer_text: Death is not the end but it's the beginning of another new life. Obviously I'm not telling this from my experiences :D. But I've spoken to many experts and listened many people whom I can trust on such topics. The reasoning was also logical. So everyday, we go through lot of experiences, and out of all those experiences, one of them is what we remember or think before sleeping. Every week, we go through lot of experiences, and out of all those experiences, one of them is what we remember or think before the Monday arrives. Every month and every year same exercise is repeated in our mind, consciously or unconsciously, before the next cycle begins. So there are some thoughts which stays like a “thick line on a rock”. And what's more surprising is that one thing which stays there in our head throughout our life repeats at the moment of our death and it just continues in the next birth too. In next birth, these thoughts are nothing but could manifest themselves in form of a craving to do something or achieve something or a desire for money/name/fame or they're some kind of aversion towards a thing or people that we don't want or we don't like. So either there's a desire or an aversion towards people or things. Each one of us have some unconditional craving or aversion towards few things from our childhood. If we have some unfinished tasks before death(which are actually only in our head only), then we end up taking birth again to achieve that unfinished business. On the contrary, people who do not have any thick line on a rock, they’d be more calm, satisfied, happy in their next birth and might as well be reaching to enlightenment faster. Just an example, I always felt doing something for the poor people or doing something for the environment at the cost of my time. None of which is related to me, specially the poor people. If you think deeply about your past years(NOT past birth) and recollect those moments when you felt something which was so sudden could as well be from last births. So that is one possibility of what happens after death. Another is the enlightenment which happens during the life to break this “chain of births after births” and keep performing Karmas and developing more and more desires. Once you attain a state that you've no desires for anything on this planet,even one should not be desired towards enlightenment. Just living an equanimous life with no craving and no aversion and accepting the present moment as it is. This will lead you towards enlightenment and hence you won't take birth again but go in another dimension!

No idea! I mean, I haven't died yet and even after I do I doubt I'll be able to come back and tell you. I suspect if I did, you'd not be so amenable cuz I'd be a ghost. If you ask me what I think happens, then I suspect after we die we simply go back to existing as energy instead of matter. Yes, maybe in a different dimension. I don't believe in the afterlife and heaven and hell. I believe everything is a part of the great cosmic energy. And I believe we are simply a part of this great cycle. Everything exists as energy and we are simply manifestations of that energy in this dimension. The concept of dimension applies here because I think human beings cannot perceive all dimensions that exist. Our vision is limited by our mortal coil. We see only what we are able to within the limits of our body. We can't see energy anyway. We see light because it is in the spectrum our eyes can see. We don't see xrays or uv rays because our eyes can't, but our body perceives it and so we suffer the effects of it. One might say, by this logic, that xrays exist in a different dimension, one we cannot see but we do feel. Even time is a dimension, one we cannot perceive visually, but we perceive it physically. This way there may be many dimensions that we don't perceive physically or visually but we may perceive mentally. Some we may not be able to perceive at all. I think once we die, the knowledge and everything we learned in this present life is transmitted as energy (read information) and after death it goes back to the cloud. I don't know if we would exist with our present identities or consciousness but I do believe all the information we acquired in this life becomes a part of the energy/info cloud.

45 years ago when I was 16 I was in bed in my room sick.next I knew I opened my eyes and looked down and noticed my toes were pointing down towards the ground.i was in a upright position about Ceiling height looking down on my body that I could see below me..Below my feet I could see my bedroom and the normal light that you would expect to see but 1 foot below my feet and up I raised my head and I was clearly in a nother dimension which was not my room but a darker place right above my feet.i felt someone in the room( Dimension) with me so I turned to the right of me and it looked like a person .I asked,what happened.it said you quit breathing.i quickly turned my head back to the left to look at my body below me to the left and right in front of me out of the darkness white and gray smoke Swirling slowly came up to me.i felt a hand grab my chin and pulled down on my chin to open my mouth and blew in my mouth untill my lungs were filled.then all of a sudden I went back to my body. I have to say when I was up there I felt tranquility and a tremendous amount of love.in my body I was sick again when I returned back to my body. I was young at that time i always said I was in a another dimension which was darker then this dimension I could clearly see the difference between the 2 dimensions below my feet And dimension I was in when I died.This was year ago and I only told my wife what had happen to me .one day she read in the paper where people have died and flotted above there bodys.

According to Bhagwat Geeta after death your destination will be decided on basis of what deed you have done in your valueable life. Your spirit will go to Heaven if you are kind heart person,did good to everyone ,didn’t harm anyone, not being selfish, loving etc. Once your all good did debt will be paid to you your soul will again comes back to materialistic world have a new life In another case your soul will go to Hell if you are a bad guy. Who life has been spent on fullfilling the demands that your senses urges to you. Being cruel, proudy,criminal, rapist etc. Your soul will comes back to the materialist world after you will receive and paid your sentence. Or else your soul will go for Eternal bliss if you are able to gain complete command on your senses and their subjects, complete your duty without worrying or willing about the outcomes, And realising God is one and everything I got as a outcome of my duty, need devote to almigty God .And by being stable mind person in all situation. Considering everyone as equal. So therefore as per above only your soul will move to other dimenson.

Nope, you end up in this world. All the energy that flows in your brain is dissipated and will then interact with other things. Think of the energy in a pan of boiling water. If you destroy the pan, the energy (heat, etc.) in the water dissipates and flow around, like it is supposed to do in the absence of a vessel (your body and cells). It is what happens with lizards, trees and wombats. As to the non-energy part of your body, your cells, minerals, and all matter there, this matter is left to recombine with other things in the world because there is no energy to hold it together. As to some evidence pointing to this, think of how the world was before your atoms came together as a living thing and started to function. I mean the wold before you existed. Your atoms and energy were already around, and after you -and I - dissipate, it will be the same thing as before we existed, our “constituent parts” (matter and energy) will still be around this world for grabs :)

There is no evidence either way, and no one has ever returned to tell us. You can believe what you want. You may choose to believe that we end up in another world where everything is perfect (heaven) or where everything is horrid (hell) for instance. Alternatively you might like to imagine a world that is run by lizards or where gravity is reversed or where custard is as valuable as gold. Really, the options are endless and the evidence to support any of them is equally absent.  I personally believe that when we die, we cease to exist. That seems to me to be the most likely scenario, and no one has yet been able to disprove it.

I don’t believe so. I don’t currently see how that would be possible. Nothing in reality attests to anything except this reality. You may as well ask if the candle flame goes somewhere when extinguished. If there were another reality- we could not infer so, or anything about it from all this. Science would have found a way by now. Instead, everything we have found confirms material reality is nothing other than material. There are complexities to it we have found, but no ghost in the machine that suggests anything spiritual. There is no seeming magic that defies the way reality normally operates. Your Kuerig isn’t going to make coffee without water in it. What in this reality would even suggest there is another waiting beyond death?

When I died, I could feel the release of the physical pain contained within my mortal body as my heart ceased functioning. Thoughts lost meaning and where discarded as so much flotsam, as I drifted more and more into this void I became free from the rigors of life. I was encompassed within a great nothingness, devoid of self-awareness, it was a true nonexistence . . . but at the time, I was unaware of the void/nonexistence and only became aware when I regained consciousness. . . . and yes, it was another dimension that I spent 5 weeks in.

This question has a another question inside it. May be this question is related to the soul or invisible particle that comes out from the body. If science says that ENERGY can’t be created or can’t be destroyed, only changes the form, then THE ENERGY that gives life may be transformed or transferred to another “OBJECT”. This object should exist in another dimension. This energy particle or soul is may be made of unknown dimension.SO, we can say that after we die ,we go to another dimension. Please give opinion, so I can clear my view if I got wrong here.

I doubt that we “go” anywhere. If I build a Lego house, then take it apart and put the bricks back in the bucket, where has the house “gone”? You can examine every brick but there isn’e a trace of “house-ness” about any of them. The house hasn’t “gone” anywhere; it was an emergent property of the arrangement of the bricks and ceased to exist on disassembly. I think we’re the same. We are patterns of electrical activity in our central nervous systems and when that fades we are “gone”. Not “gone away”, not “gone to”, just “gone”.

Yes it is possible. There are many possibilities but I find the most viable thing that is remotely closest to evidence that we have is NDEs. These personal experiences are hard to verify because they are…well personal. You cannot just enter someone’s NDE or put it in a test tube to verify it as real or not. We really don’t know for sure and people that say they know as a fact are full of themselves because they can’t know unless they die themselves but my theory points to either another dimension, waking up and realizing it was all a dream or a reincarnation/reset making for a clean slate.

Yes, unless you get stuck as a ghost in physical reality, and haunt some castle or a bar, or attach to another living being as an energy parasite. Well, those are also not exactly in physical reality but on the low astral plane (4D), but it is pretty close to our realm, that’s why people can feel or see ghosts and attachments. Everybody else crosses over into higher dimensions.

Death as we look at is actually a manfiestation of our beliefs which can have different definitions in different cultures. So a mundane answer lies in the cultural beliefs you have scientifically speaking it is not more than a running system coming to a permanent halt. We tend to attach emotions with death hence so many assumptions and beliefs otherwise a dead person remains in the same 3 dimensional world we live. Just the form/state changes.

Maybe, it depends on what you view as another dimension.If you mean in a physical sense such as that of a cemetery, or a cryostasis chamber. Then we could define that mathematical location by the length, width, and height of your body’s location as the new dimension you’re now located.If you mean in another context, then I offer my condolences in reporting the memories/soul/conscience that made up you would’ve passed when your body did.

There is no evidence but existence is full of mysteries and we are way to far from understanding it let alone discovering something about it. In that sense anything is possible. What's more, ages of wisdom certainly did not entertain the concept of after-life for no reason. Furthermore no one knows from what, where and how they may have inherited or produced this concept. In sum, there is a high likelihood that existence may be a part of a cycle.

Yes. Personally whether you believe it or not I've died many times only to wake up in another time line similar to mine but only in the past a few months before my so called death. In the new dimension most things are the same even identical but the problem is you cannot remember how you died or even what comes next , you wont even remember it's a repeat until after you do something the same and you get this feeling in your mind way stronger the dejavu.

According to Gods True Word, the bible..all go to heaven or the lake of fire in eternity. We have been given this life to accept Gods plan of redemption and be forgiven, through the sacrifice of His Son Jesus Christ, so as to live with Him in heaven forever. One life, one choice, one destination..Read the christian bible if you truly want to know God, His Son Jesus and His truth. You can either listen to satan and the world or seek God and His truth. God bless your journey.

If we are reincarnated as another being, but that being lacks any of our memories, then in what sense are we that being? It’s as if I claim, yesterday my soul went into my dog’s body, and my dog’s soul went into my body. I can’t provide you any evidence, because the soul is immaterial, and so by definition you can’t test for it. So in what sense could I be wrong or right about swapping souls with my dog, and what difference would it make?

When we die there is nothing no other life no mind memories no thought no dreams no feeling and no sensory imports just nothing as everything we are do think remember and feel are all produced by electro-chemical signals between neurons when we die they stop so we also stop

Yes, you go to the dead dimension. In this dimension time ceases to exist, all earthly senses are turned off, and your thoughts will be totally turned to your creator and you will comprehend his total essence. Please carefully read this answer from both a theist and atheist point of view. It's true either way. I hope this helps.
Well, let’s rephrase that as when the BODY dies! I’ve also answered a similar question elsewhere: Hannah Bayne's answer to What is death according to quantum physics?
I don't believe so. Every being is an energy. And energy can be neither created nor destroyed, only transformed. So they don't go to another realm or anything.
’You’ end up in the same place ’you’ were in before ’you’ were conceived: nowhere.
No. Spirits are vibrations within this “dimension”. Energy cannot be created or destroyed, so going to Heaven or Hell would violate the laws of physics.
Yes, for a time. https://billymeier.files.wordpress.com/2020/06/reincarnation-incarnation-process-sec2.pdf
